title: Status of Move?
content: It's been a long while since we heard anything about this supposedly imminent forum move. Is Cho'gall still planning something? This place is now well beyond stifling.

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
Agreed. Honestly, I don't care so much if someone is paying for this service. We haven't been in contact with them the same way they haven't been in contact with us. And besides...

I AM STILL EXPOSED TO ADS WHEN I LOG IN! Or is that just me?

The person paying for this "subscription" is someone who was gone from the community before my time. And it's been well more than 2 years since I joined! I usually don't participate in the "When are we going to move" threads but... you got to admit... Ez Board is ass. (But to be fair, I do like some of the features that aren't in PHP BB and the GUI is pretty solid.)

Like I said before, I don't care if someone is paying for this. They aren't USING THIS! I say screw it and we move. If no one can email Chogall or get ahold of him... that's not our problem. He would be wasting his money just the same if say, the community had fallen apart 6 months ago.

I mean... yes, I am greatfull for the service... and at the same time I'm not. Hell, even *I* have my own forum and I didn't have to pay ANYTHING for it. It was a nice gesture back when I was 16, didn't have a job and knew nothing of webhosting. Now it's like investing in a mud farm. The service you pay for is right in your own back yard.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
Right. And I get exposed to ads when I login, too. Although I don't have to login so often thanks to Firefox keeping the login cookies, sometimes they expire prematurely and I have to go to the stupid login page and say "No, thanks" every time.

It's time to realize it, phpBB kicks ass.------------------------------

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
I think vBulletin has more features than phpBB, but either choice is better than ezBoard.

You know, though, we don't *have* to wait for Cho'gall to move the board. We could always create one on the side, and then Cho'gall might notice and close this board.
Anyway, when the board moves, is it going to move to CC314? Because I think it'd be much easier if it were hosted on its own site. After all, typing "pckf.com" is easier than typing "classicgaming.com/cc314/forum."-Genius314

title: Matus of Stove
content:
[hr]Gal I AM STILL EXPOSED TO ADS WHEN I LOG IN! Or is that just me?
[hr]Indeed. Though it's quickly avoided by typing pckf.com back into the address bar once logged in, it's stupid that we're still getting such intrusive ads with a paid service.

[hr]Gal *Starts singing Tool*
[hr]"You just BANED djaser"
"I am leaving now"

IMKO, Cho'gall is no longer a key player in the Keen community. Nor is eK. I don't know either of them anywhere near as well as I know the regulars here. Sure, they made great contributions to getting the community off the ground, and I appreciate their effort. However, they're no longer relevant to the community and those of us that are need to take control of things and set the place up in a way that serves our growing needs.

We've procrastinated for years, and we've probably lost a fair few potential members due to sign up issues (like confirmation emails not going through), which would be manageable with a better forum. This forum would still remain open until its payment (hopefully) runs out, and gradually we would lock sections out as more people move to the new one. So there would be no interruptions.

I don't want to divide the community, but if we keep procrastinating the move will never happen. A new forum is easy to setup, and there's enough collective expertise between us to get things up and running in no time.

title: Re: Matus of Stove
content:
Okay then, well where are Grafix and Xtra? I'd expect either of them would be hosting it, possibly Xtra because of having dosclassics.com going for so long.

I of course would be happy to volunteer webspace, but I expect I'm still seen as only a minor player in the community, so most people would prefer someone who's been around for a bit longer.

That conversion of the forum Grafix did some time back looked great, so with his help we won't even have to start from scratch, all the old topics could be taken across too.

We will of course need the support of an admin, and I think Xtra is the only one who regularly pops by. I think it would be best if the switchover to the new forum was done in one go rather than gradually (otherwise it'll be too difficult to transfer existing threads across), so we'd need an admin to close down this forum and put up a redirection message to the new address.

So - Xtra, Grafix, are either of you prepared to host a replacement PCKF? (Or is there someone else I'm forgetting about?)[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Matus of Stove
content:
Hey, I'm here quite regularly, every day, as far as I know! However, I won't close down the forum and set messages redirecting to the new board -- unless Cho'gall gives permission to do that. And I doubt any other admin will participate in that either, it'd be pretty much taking over the board. I just e-mailed to Cho'gall about this topic, let's see what's going on.

However, I can't seriously see how change of the forum can do so much change in everything. You guys seem like it's the end of the world if it doesn't change soon, or that it'll be like heaven of creativity and Keenishness when it changes. Of course I hope that but I really can't see thousand projects will pop up and finish themselves just because the forum changes, I can't see people being so inspired by it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

If you're going to switch the board before it officially happens, well, I don't know if I will join. I've said that I won't, but probably I will anyways, just because everyone else leaves this. I think you'd be trusted Malvineous, you seem like a responsible person and hosting and maintaining the Keen wiki has been excellent. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Not to mention you've probably edited it the most. There's no problem in the others, either... However, personally I think it should have a place of its own, all Keen, and not be part of some existing site or system such as dosclassics.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Matus of Stove
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Spambots? That's what moderators are for.[hr][/quote]
Right. I myself really enjoyed manually deleting 20 posts and 2 spambots every day. At least with SMF you can pick to delete the user AND all his posts at once. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] (Actually, I haven't had any spambots at all yet since I switched.)

I'd like the new forum system to be linked to from www.pckf.com, with a link to the old forum of course, but that might take some time to discuss with the other mods and admins.____________
Don't see me as an ordinary man.
Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
Oh, and [url=http://www.tengusoft.net/]Team[/url].

title: Re: Matus of Stove
content:
Oh, sorry KR, I didn't realise you were an admin - last time I looked you were a moderator.

I agree that the forum should not be part of an existing site, however this is unrelated to who hosts it. My server currently powers www.shikadi.net, but equally it could power www.pckf.com as well (actually it sits behind wiki.commanderkeen.org too, but there's only one script sitting there which redirects everything to the main wiki URL, as you'll see if you visit a URL like [url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Vorticon]wiki.commanderkeen.org/Vorticon[/url]) I'm sure Xtra's hosting plan allows him to do the same, and I know Grafix's does.

You're right in that moving to a different forum won't make a huge difference, but a new layout would be a breath of fresh air, and modern forum systems would make it just that bit easier to read posts (for example something I'd really like is for topics to be automatically marked read once you've opened them, because correctly marking things read is a bit of an art with ezBoard.)
[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
You guys should think about how a new place would benefit the community or wouldn't. Personally I fear that another loss of previous posts and user accounts would give community a serious blow. On the other hand I hate the idea that we have to wait for Chogall to do anything. Let's face it; he won't do anything anyway. You all should just decide whatever to leave or stay and get over it. Seeing this kind of topics popping every three months is just sad. -----------------

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
If anyone would host the new forum I would probably guess it would be Xtra.

First off "Beyond the Pogo", the page Xtra has set up, is in my opinion VASTLY superior to ANY other Commander Keen fan page out there. It looks the best and has the most information on it. (Or at least used to before the wiki.)
Besides, he hosted B&S before I got my own webspace. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mischief.gif[/img]

But that all depends on if Extra is even willing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]
It really doesn't matter though because, as was pointed out earlier in this thread, pretty much anyone would be willing to shell out the chash to make it happen.

I always thought CC314 was a crappily made fanpage anyway. It looked terrible, was somewhat hard to find things and well... it didn't... look... Commander Keen at all.
That and, it was dead before I found this community anyway. (Actually I found this forum RIGHT after CC314 was shut down. The thread announcing it was still fresh.) To say that the people who ran this forum and CC314 years ago still have a say in what happens here is actually... pretty silly.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
[hr]KeenRush However, I can't seriously see how change of the forum can do so much change in everything. You guys seem like it's the end of the world if it doesn't change soon, or that it'll be like heaven of creativity and Keenishness when it changes. Of course I hope that but I really can't see thousand projects will pop up and finish themselves just because the forum changes, I can't see people being so inspired by it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
[hr]I certainly don't expect a dramatic shift in people's attitudes as a direct result of moving to a different forum system. What I do expect is a new atmosphere of professionalism, stability and permanence.

Being able to actually search the forums would be nice, for starters. As would a quote tag system that won't trash the post if you make one slip-up. Oh, and as Malvineous says, a proper thread-marking tool would make things much more comfortable. Simple things like this make the move worth it.

[hr]KeenRush I think you'd be trusted Malvineous, you seem like a responsible person and hosting and maintaining the Keen wiki has been excellent.
[hr]I second that sentiment.

[hr]djaser You guys should think about how a new place would benefit the community or wouldn't. Personally I fear that another loss of previous posts and user accounts would give community a serious blow.
[hr]Switching forums won't result in a loss of posts. The existing database can and will be copied across. The benefit is beyond doubt, it's just the political issues that pose an obstacle.

[hr]djaser On the other hand I hate the idea that we have to wait for Chogall to do anything. Let's face it; he won't do anything anyway. You all should just decide whatever to leave or stay and get over it. Seeing this kind of topics popping every three months is just sad.
[hr]Agreed. Waiting for one person, who has outgrown the game, is pointless. If he personally drops in here and indicates he has an imminent plan, that he'll make the forum stand-alone (independent of CC314) and listen to input from the rest of us as to how we'd like it to be, I'll reconsider my stance.

Until then, I find him irrelevant to the issue at hand. If the opinion and discussion within the community is overruled by one person it never has any contact with, what's the point of it?

[hr]Gal I always thought CC314 was a crappily made fanpage anyway. It looked terrible, was somewhat hard to find things and well... it didn't... look... Commander Keen at all.
[hr]As were my thoughts. Although it was interesting to explore for a while, it's well and truly dead now. I no longer see any logic whatsoever in the phrase, "This Commander Keen forum belongs to Cerebral Cortex 314, the #1 Commander Keen site."

Beyond the Pogo has been the staple Keen site for a long time, and this forum has had nothing to do with CC314 for even longer. As far as I see it, waiting for Cho'gall to move the site is comparable to waiting for ID to release the Keen source code.

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
Personally, I was waiting for the gold status to be close to expiry to persue the move.

However it's 65 days now until this place returns to the quagmire of adland.

Yes I do agree that it should no longer be affiliated with cc314. It just doesn't make sense, I haven't updated it in almost 3 years now. In its defense though, cc314 was a very good site when it was first made. Everything else was basically crap. i.e. [url=http://www.fortunecity.com/skyscraper/joystick/56/index.htm]www.fortunecity.com/skysc.../index.htm[/url]

Anyways. I'm behind a move, I just don't want to have to be involved. It's definately needed, and BtP is the obvious and best choice.

I open myself now to criticism and all that stuff...--------------------

title: my take
content:
Things like this always pop up when I'm away... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img]

My personal vision of a new PCKF would be one running something like PunBB or SMF, although I would personally go for PunBB as I don't like the fact that SMF uses the bug-prone concept of "mods". (PunBB does at the moment too, but the beta version has support for plugins.)

As for hosting, I think that DOSClassics would probably be the most appropriate site. Although I don't doubt Malvineous' ability as a sysadmin, his server has a tendency to be rather slow under load. I would have gone for my own host, as their architecture and support are excellent, but I suspect it would cost a fair bit more than hosting it elsewhere.

There shouldn't be any worries about losing posts or users from the forum - I tested out the ezBoard-to-phpBB converter on this forum a while ago, and it worked almost perfectly. (Unfortunately the demo board with the converted posts is no longer online, as spambots were starting to noticably chew up my bandwidth.) We could then use a converter to move the posts from the phpBB database to the forum software of our choice.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
Unfortunately, only Xtra and Keen Rush could really be considered active admins. Really, the thing is we need to 1. agree on a board, and 2. agree on a host. It's that simple, and that complicated.

After that, the move's simple. The fact that there really isn't an active Keen webpage at the moment makes things a little difficult to choose a host, but I know Cho'gall's still willing to do so, and has registered cc314.com for that express purpose, though of course others have brought up the valid point of its death of more than two years. Anyways, yes, please get back on topic so that something can actually be decided.--------------------
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/]Cerebral Cortex 314[/url] - For All of your Commander Keen Needs.
[url=http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/dave/joes.html]Eat at Joes[/url]

title: Forearm Movie
content:
When it comes to a host, it's only really a matter of bandwidth. IMKO, the board should be a stand-alone entity, linked directly from pckf.com. Thus the activity of any other page hosted on the server is irrelevant, except in regard to its expected permanence.

NearlyFreeSpeech would be an ideal solution, with a lot of nifty features, including a PayPal donation system. That would make it completely self-sufficient, and not reliant on a private server.

As grafix says though, it may also prove more expensive. Nonetheless, there are bandwidth buckets available, so if we can accurately gauge how much bandwidth we would need in a given time, large discounts are possible.

So, what are the options regarding the forum system?

phpBB (less likely)
Simple Machines
PunBB (most likely)

Anyone care to post further pros/cons list for these boards, and/or add another to the list? Then we'll have something on which to base a decision.

title: once more
content:
Forum software: Having looked around, I'd now say that [url=http://bbpress.org]bbPress[/url] is the ideal solution. It's written by some of the WordPress team, and it has the key advantages of being fast and very easy to extend - no more dodgy mods that break every time you upgrade! Additionally, it has Askimet spam protection built in. (Askimet is a service provided by WordPress.com that filters spam from blogs and forums. It's free for small blogs and forums, and it works very well.) Although bbPress is still in beta, it's being used by a number of large services already, and I believe it could work very well.

If people don't think bbPress is a good idea, I think we'd be best going for PunBB. It's a well-established forum solution with a range of themes and mods available, and it is both faster and more secure than phpBB. Unfortunately, the new plugin system they're introducing isn't quite of the calibre I was hoping for, but I'm sure it'd work much better than modding the code directly.

Hosting: [url=http://https://www.nearlyfreespeech.net/]NearlyFreeSpeech[/url] are the company I host with, and they do have excellent support and facilities (as I mentioned before). They make it very easy for users to donate directly to their customer's hosting bills, meaning that we could implement a "community chest" feature similar to the one ezBoard provides. However, it's hard to tell whether they're a viable choice without knowing the amount of bandwidth these forums use - can any of the admins help out here?

If NearlyFreeSpeech turns out not to be cost-effective, we could always ask xtra to host the forum on DOSClassics. My only worry is that if xtra somehow drops out of touch with the community or he stops paying his hosting bills, then the forum goes down the can. The advantage of NearlyFreeSpeech is that as long as someone is paying the bills, the site stays up - and that means that it could survive solely off of donations if the account holder were to disappear. It would also be much less effort to transfer the site to a new account holder if necessary.

Any comments?

title: wtf
content: Actually, scrap my previous comment. Having looked at the (exorbitant) pricing for Gold Community, I've concluded that NearlyFreeSpeech is definitely the best solution for the boards. Even on the most expensive bandwidth package, it's still way cheaper than ezBoard. In fact, it'd be more cost-effective than almost any other hosting solution (balancing the cost of random downtime and unhelpful support) unless the boards are consuming over 7GB of traffic a month.[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: not quite decided
content:
I'm currently in the process of testing out converting posts from the PCKF. Whilst doing so, I've realised that the existing ezBoard converter is fairly poor. Although it converts plain text posts OK, it does badly when BBCode or smilies are present in the post. It doesn't convert users particularly well either. A certain amount can be done to fix up the posts once they are converted, but there is still a lot of ezBoard cruft left over. I personally believe I could make a much better job of building a converter, but it would take a long time - and I'm fairly short on time right now. So, either:

a) I convert the posts with the current converter. The archived posts will look messy for a while, but should eventually be neatened up. or
b) We wait for me to write a better converter. This could take as long as a month, and I might end up not being able to complete it and simply going for option a).
Thoughts?

(Also, we'll be running phpBB for a while if we go for option a). I'll have to clean up the posts before they can be converted to a better forum system.)

title: Re: not quite decided
content:
Surely writing a converter couldn't be too hard if you made it with a bunch of regular expressions. Things like smilies would be easy once you have a list of filenames and what they should be converted to, and the HTML code should be uniform enough that a regular expression could easily pick it apart. I'd have a go at writing one if I had a little more time at the moment, so if this discussion is still going on in a week or two I'll try then.

At any rate I think the converter should convert the forum into a more useful format like XML, since then you can write an XML import filter for any forum system you want, and the converter isn't tied to a particular platform - it becomes an "ezBoard exporter" and then you get hold of an importer for your particular forum system.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

title: jackalope?
content:
That was, in fact, pretty similar to the idea I had. I'd probably store the ezBoard data in a SQLite database as opposed to XML, as I'm not heavily acquainted with XML parsing.

To be honest, writing an ezBoard screen-scraper isn't too tricky. Although the horrific HTML syntax that ezBoard spews out doesn't lend itself to being parsed by regular expressions or a standard XML parser, it can be done. It's also fairly easy to convert emoticons and BBCode (helpfully, they are both enclosed in <!--EZCODE--> comments).

The main reason why it takes a lot of effort to write a proper ezBoard converter is that you need to tie up all the loose ends, as well as writing clean code. The current converter for phpBB is a quick and messy application, and just about does the job. A better converter would retrieve user data from ezBoard, allow the proper handling of signatures (which is not that hard either), and possibly even put the posts it retrieves in the right order! :P

title: well...
content: We already suffered a "huge loss" when EzBoard tripped all over itself over a year ago... the community bounced back, and most of the material that was available before the crash is still at hand; we could move onto a clean shiny new board and suffer only a minimal downtime, I think.  Why so much fuss/delay over conversion?

title: Re: well...
content:
I suppose it's a fair point - we get annoyed when someone posts to an old topic, so they're only there for reference - and as a reference, it doesn't really matter whether they're in a forum format or not. We could always just mirror the whole ezBoard forum as static HTML and leave that as a reference, and start the new forum fresh.

In some ways, I think I would prefer starting a fresh - I guess as long as the old data is archived *somewhere* so it's not lost forever then it doesn't bother me whether it's in the new forum or not.[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/]KeenWiki[/url] | [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/]ModdingWiki[/url]

If it's possible to create an entirely separate account under a general PCKF name that would be even better, so it's not under a specific person's name.
[hr]Yup, that be the plan. How many NFSers do we have around here?

I'm working on creating a new account as generically as possible. It's best I put it under my name though, so there's actually someone physically representing it. I just need to create a new email address for it.

I'm looking into setting up a PayPal donation system. It's possible to do this through NearlyFreeSpeech, but the funds cannot be withdrawn once deposited, so we'd have to be certain that this is the place we want to be (which indeed we pretty much are), and that we're not planning to use the money for other purposes besides bandwidth.

title: Re: Status of Move?
content:
Andrew's putting aside a nice little spot on his server for us and setting up another phpBB. So, it'll be similar to Keen: Modding, though I suppose we can modify it quite a bit to our liking. Once it's there, well it can be modified to everyone's liking.

Yeah, sorry for the sort of surprise this all is though...it was kind of sudden.

So what we have: A completely free message board system (phpBB)
A stable server (Andrew Durdin's)

What we don't have: An address (yet. Soon though)--------------------
